Service.definition: the act of delivering to or informing someone of a writ

1.definition: the act of delivering to or informing someone of a writ, summons, or other notice as prescribed by law [after of process] see alsoat,,
1.note: Although service of process is primarily the means for a court to exert personal jurisdiction over a person, some form of service (as by publication of notice in a newspaper) is also usually required for exercise of in rem or quasi in rem jurisdiction.

2 a.definition: useful labor that does not produce a tangible commodity usually used in pl. [payment forrendered]

sub_terms.b: the maintenance or repair of tangible property [machinery for the and improvement of the residence]vt

sub_terms.a: to meet interest and sinking fund payments on (debt) [didn't have the cash flow to a large loan]
sub_terms.b: to collect payments and maintain a payment schedule for (a loan) esp. after sale of the loan to a secondary mortgage market (as the Federal National Mortgage Association) compare
